channel.title: Talks By L. Tom Perry
channel.description: General Conference talks by L. Tom Perry.

image.title: General Conference talks by L. Tom Perry.

item.title: Three Pledges
item.description: Elder Loren Dunn, as I left for lunch, whispered in my ear and said, “They grade General Authorities on how little time they take in their first address.” I am trying for a straight A today.

item.title: Consider Your Ways
item.description: “Now therefore thus saith the Lord of hosts; Consider your ways.”

item.title: “I Will Go and Do the Things Which the Lord Hath Commanded”
item.description: There is a section in old Boston town where the gas lanterns still adorn the streets to remind us of a bygone era of “the old lamplighter”—a profession that has become obsolete with the modern age. But the service of bringing light to a troubled worl

item.title: Build Your Shield of Faith
item.description: Thank you, President. This is a general conference in which I find my emotions very close to the surface. I have just been sustained by a vote of the membership of the Church to a position which is overwhelming. I hope under the circumstances it is p

item.title: “When Thou Art Converted, Strengthen Thy Brethren”
item.description: I have recently had the opportunity of returning to school, at least for a five-day period. I was invited to attend a data processing school. After the usual adjustments of trying to condition myself again to a classroom situation, I was captivated b

item.title: A Tribute
item.description: As difficult as it may be, I would like to pay tribute today to a very noble soul who found the joy in living a life of service.

item.title: For the Time Will Come When They Will Not Endure Sound Doctrine
item.description: One of the exciting opportunities which comes from the general conference for me is to arrive a little early and have the privilege of walking through the aisles of this great Tabernacle, greeting the conference visitors as they are here assembled. Y

item.title: “As a Man Soweth”
item.description: “And it came to pass that the Lord spake unto Moses saying: Behold, I reveal unto you concerning this heaven, and this earth; write the words which I speak. I am the Beginning and the End, the Almighty God; by mine Only Begotten I created these thing

item.title: A Report on the Church’s Participation in America’s Bicentennial Celebration
item.description: As we approach the end of 1976, it seems appropriate for me to direct my remarks to the Church’s participation in the United States of America’s observance of its Bicentennial celebration.

item.title: But Be Ye Doers of the Word
item.description: “But be ye doers of the word, and not hearers only, deceiving your own selves.

item.title: The Role of the Stake Bishops Council in Welfare Services
item.description: My brothers and sisters, how great it is to meet with you in general conference. I have been asked to discuss the role of the stake bishops council and its chairman. This council exists for a vital purpose, but I am not sure that we all recognize its

item.title: Father—Your Role, Your Responsibility
item.description: The Book of Mormon tells a remarkable story about a father who loved his son so much he gave him his own name. The father was chief high priest in the land, and spent much of his days administering to the spiritual needs of the people. How disappoint

item.title: “Trust in the Lord”
item.description: From the book of Psalms we read:

item.title: Home Teaching—A Sacred Calling
item.description: “And it came to pass that after I, the Lord God, had driven them out, that Adam began to till the earth, and to have dominion over all the beasts of the field, and to eat his bread by the sweat of his brow, as I the Lord had commanded him. And Eve, a

item.title: The Kingdom of God
item.description: I was on an airplane a few weeks ago on my way home. On the seat next to mine was a news magazine opened to an article which intrigued me. It was entitled “The Doubting American—A Growing Breed” ( 26 Feb. 1979, p. 74). Its message was that belief, th

item.title: Making the Right Decisions
item.description: Leaving the Tabernacle after the Saturday afternoon session of the last few conferences, I have been impressed with the lines forming to gain admission to the priesthood session some three hours before its beginning. I have stopped to visit with thos

item.title: Nauvoo—A Demonstration of Faith
item.description: My attention has been directed toward the great history of this Church during this, its sesquicentennial year. There is a period of Mormon history which has always been a great source of inspiration to me. Emerging out of what I would believe the dar

item.title: “For Whatsoever a Man Soweth, That Shall He Also Reap”
item.description: “For the earth is full, and there is enough and to spare; yea, I prepared all things and have given unto the children of men to be agents unto themselves” ().

item.title: The Need to Teach Personal and Family Preparedness
item.description: A lesson on preparedness was taught by the Lord in the twenty-fifth chapter of Matthew. It tells about ten virgins awaiting a marriage celebration. Five were wise and prepared. Five were foolish and not prepared. The five wise virgins were welcomed i

item.title: When Ye Are Prepared, Ye Shall Not Fear
item.description: Traveling to the four corners of the world we encounter all too often a spirit of gloom among the people. Their concerns range from wars, rumors of wars, famine, and inflation to drug addiction, climate changes, pollution, bigness of government, etc.

item.title: Let Us Go Up to the House of God
item.description: The assignment we were given for Saturday evening sessions of stake conference during the first half of 1982 was directed toward the theme “Let us go up to the mountain of the Lord, to the house of the God of Jacob.” (.) The objective of these meetin

item.title: “For a Bishop Must Be Blameless”
item.description: This conference marks the beginning of a new era for the Church in communications. The advent of the satellite affords us the opportunity of reaching more of the membership of the Church with general conference than we have ever had the privilege of

item.title: Train Up a Child
item.description: “Train up a child in the way he should go,” writes the author of Proverbs, “and when he is old, he will not depart from it.” (.)

item.title: “Our Father Which Art in Heaven”
item.description: One of the special opportunities we have as General Authorities is to visit the stakes of Zion. Thirty to forty times each year we find ourselves staying in the home of a different stake president. We have the privilege of being guests in the greates

item.title: “Go Ye Therefore, and Teach All Nations”
item.description: Before I begin my prepared message, I would personally like to thank two great women for their devoted years of service. Sister Smith and Sister Cannon, you have been like great beacons of light to guide the women of the Church and many, many others

item.title: “And Why Call Ye Me, Lord, Lord, and Do Not the Things Which I Say?”
item.description: Let me first offer my sincere congratulations to Elder Hanks—we know of your great talent—and to Elders Sonnenberg, Kay, and Wilcox. How you’ll enjoy this new association!

item.title: “Born of Goodly Parents”
item.description: To Bishop Brown, Bishop Peterson, Bishop Clarke, I just want to express my deep love and appreciation for your great devoted years of service. To Bishop Hales, Bishop Eyring, Bishop Pace, I want you to know that I’m ready to assist in any way that yo

item.title: “I Confer the Priesthood of Aaron”
item.description: I have invited a special young man to assist me with my presentation tonight. I would like to introduce Terry Haws, my oldest grandson.

item.title: The Law of the Fast
item.description: The great lessons of the scriptures teach us over and over again how foolish it is for mankind to desert the ways of the Lord and rely on the arm of flesh. One of the certainties of life is that mankind, individually and collectively, will cycle thro

item.title: The Joy of Honest Labor
item.description: Elder Wirthlin, I too add my welcome to a most unique body of men. You’ll find men with dark hair and grey hair, some even with wider parts than others. And their personalities are just as varied as their hairstyles. That’s the great blessing of belo

item.title: “United in Building the Kingdom of God”
item.description: President, I’m starting to receive the distinct impression that we’ve been listening to you. I, too, will take my text from the Book of Mormon, that great and ancient record that offers us special perspective that comes only from studying what is rou

item.title: “A Meaningful Celebration”
item.description: We have just completed a summer in which we have commemorated several events of great historical significance. On the twenty-fourth of July, we celebrated the 140th anniversary of the arrival of the Mormon pioneers in the Salt Lake Valley. At the sam

item.title: “In the World”
item.description: “If ye were of the world, the world would love his own: but … ye are not of the world, but I have chosen you out of the world” ().

item.title: “Train Up a Child”
item.description: Elder Scott, I would just like to add my welcome to the others that have been given to you as you assume this great position. You are joining a unique quorum. It is made up of very common men with a most uncommon calling. There is a spirit, a unity,

item.title: Proclaim My Gospel from Land to Land
item.description: From the book of First Peter, we receive this counsel:

item.title: “The Peaceable Followers of Christ”
item.description: Colonel Thomas L. Kane, a nonmember of the Church, spoke to the Historical Society of Philadelphia, as recorded in the memoirs of John R. Young. He told them that during his travels a few years before, he had passed through a very unusual city named

item.title: Family Traditions
item.description: Thank you, Brother Bowden, for that beautiful number. That’s a difficult one to follow.

item.title: “Serve God Acceptably with Reverence and Godly Fear”
item.description: “Be not afraid.” Thank you, choir, for that extra support.

item.title: Called to Serve
item.description: “And Jesus came and spake unto them, saying, All power is given unto me in heaven and in earth.

item.title: Becoming Self-Reliant
item.description: Lehi and his family, after wandering in the wilderness for eight years, came to a land they called Bountiful because it was a place of much fruit and wild honey. They came to a great sea, and they rejoiced unto the Lord because He had preserved them.

item.title: “But the Labourers Are Few”
item.description: In the fourth chapter of the book of Alma, we find one of the many accounts contained in this book where the chief spiritual leader was troubled with the performance of his people. We read:

item.title: “Behold, the Lord Hath Shown unto Me Great and Marvelous Things”
item.description: Brigham Young once counseled us to use the scriptures as follows:

item.title: Back to Gospel Basics
item.description: President Hinckley and President Monson, Tabernacle Choir, thank you for that inspiring session this morning. I only hope that the spirit of that session will hover over us as we conclude this afternoon.

item.title: “Choose the Right”
item.description: The chorus of Joseph L. Townsend’s stirring hymn text provides timeless advice about what to do when we come to a fork in the road of life. We should always

item.title: “Therefore I Was Taught”
item.description: Elder Hales, we welcome you as a member of the Council of the Twelve. Our friendship goes back, I guess, over three decades. Of course, I’ve always wondered why when I moved to New York, you moved to Boston. And then when I moved to Boston, you moved

item.title: Heed the Prophet’s Voice
item.description: Sister Grassli, on behalf of my grandchildren and hundreds of thousands of other great young people we have in the Church, that you’ve led so faithfully with such inspiration, we thank you from the bottoms of our hearts. Thank you.

item.title: An Elect Lady
item.description: Marriage is a divine institution, ordained of God. Achieving success in the home is a supernal challenge—no other success can compensate for it. Unless, however, a husband and wife learn to work together as one, marriage can also be an infernal ordea

item.title: “If Ye Are Prepared Ye Shall Not Fear”
item.description: Lehi had a marvelous dream while he journeyed with his family into the wilderness. This dream or vision of the tree of life, symbolically presented, provides us with much knowledge about life and the course we should follow. The scriptures record:

item.title: Sacrament of the Lord’s Supper
item.description: During 1995 we experienced many commemorations marking the 50th anniversary of the end of World War II. For those of us who are veterans of this terrible conflict, these commemorations have been times of thoughtful reflection. It is interesting what

item.title: “Run and Not Be Weary”
item.description: The early history of the Church records that during the winter of 1833, the Lord directed that a school of the prophets was to be organized “for their instruction in all things that are expedient for them” (). It was to be held on the second floor of

item.title: “That Spirit Which Leadeth to Do Good”
item.description: The Holy Ghost will be our constant companion if we submit ourselves to the will of our Father in Heaven.

item.title: Receive Truth
item.description: Gaining a knowledge of Him is fundamental to our mortal training. We also need to have a thirst and a desire to become acquainted with the doctrines of the kingdom.

item.title: The Articles of Faith
item.description: If you will use them as a guide to direct your studies of the Savior’s doctrine, you will find yourselves prepared to declare your witness of the restored, true church of the Lord.

item.title: Youth of the Noble Birthright
item.description: The only lasting joy and happiness you will ever find during your mortal experience will come by following the Savior.

item.title: Teach Them the Word of God with All Diligence
item.description: Our teaching will be effective if we approach it humbly through prayer and study.

item.title: A Year of Jubilee
item.description: Let us place higher priority on family prayer, family scripture study, and family home evenings and eliminate those activities that fill our lives with worldliness and evil.

item.title: “Thou Shalt Give Heed unto All His Words”
item.description: The continued expansion of technology will only bring the messages to us. … [But it is] the challenge of each individual and family … to internalize the messages of the gospel.

item.title: Discipleship
item.description: We must create … ongoing and continual processes that draw us closer to the Lord our Savior so that we can be numbered among His disciples.

item.title: Building a Community of Saints
item.description: In any community of Saints, we all work to serve each other in the best way we know how. Our work has a higher purpose because it is work to bless others and to build the kingdom of God.

item.title: The Returned Missionary
item.description: What we need is a royal army of returned missionaries reenlisted into service.

item.title: Becoming Men in Whom the Spirit of God Is
item.description: The Lord is bound by solemn covenant to bless our lives according to our faithfulness. Only He can turn us into men in whom the Spirit of God, namely the Holy Ghost, is.

item.title: Called of God
item.description: We have been given the great power of the priesthood. It blesses us individually and provides blessings for our family.

item.title: The Importance of the Family
item.description: May it be our resolve this year to build a gospel-centered home, a safe harbor from the storms of the adversary.

item.title: We Believe All That God Has Revealed
item.description: God continues to reveal His will to mankind, as He has in all periods of time when He has had authorized servants upon the earth.

item.title: Fatherhood, an Eternal Calling
item.description: May we heed the voice of the prophets, who, from the beginning of time, have warned us about the importance of fathers in the home.

item.title: What Is a Quorum?
item.description: One of the greatest blessings one can receive from being a bearer of the priesthood … is belonging to a priesthood quorum.

item.title: What Seek Ye?
item.description: Honest seekers of truth are finding answers to their questions—they are finding the Lord through His restored Church.

item.title: Blessings Resulting from Reading the Book of Mormon
item.description: Now it is up to us to study the Book of Mormon and learn of its principles and apply them in our lives.

item.title: As Now We Take the Sacrament
item.description: Partaking of the sacrament provides us with a sacred moment in a holy place.

item.title: The Plan of Salvation
item.description: We are not left alone to wander through mortality without knowing of the master plan which the Lord has designed for His children.

item.title: The Message of the Restoration
item.description: We declare to the world that the fulness of the gospel of Jesus Christ has been restored to the earth.

item.title: Raising the Bar
item.description: Be certain that you easily clear the minimum standards for service as a missionary and that you are continually raising the bar.

item.title: The Gospel of Jesus Christ
item.description: The gospel teaches us all we need to know to return to live with our Father in Heaven.

item.title: Let Him Do It with Simplicity
item.description: In our search to obtain relief from the stresses of life, may we earnestly seek ways to simplify our lives.

item.title: “Bring Souls unto Me”
item.description: Missionaries will continue to do the best they can, but wouldn’t it be better if you and I stepped up to do a job that is rightfully ours?

item.title: The Past Way of Facing the Future
item.description: The lessons of the past … prepare us to face the challenges of the future.

item.title: Mothers Teaching Children in the Home
item.description: I believe it is by divine design that the role of motherhood emphasizes the nurturing and teaching of the next generation.

item.title: The Priesthood of Aaron
item.description: The priesthood you bear is a special gift, for the giver is the Lord Himself. Use it, magnify it, and live worthy of it.

item.title: The Sabbath and the Sacrament
item.description: Let your family be filled with love as you honor the Sabbath all day long and experience its spiritual blessings throughout the week.

item.title: Perfect Love Casteth Out Fear
item.description: If you will respond to the invitation to share your beliefs and feelings about the restored gospel of Jesus Christ, a spirit of love and a spirit of courage will be your constant companion.

item.title: The Power of Deliverance
item.description: We can be delivered from the ways of evil and wickedness by turning to the teachings of the holy scriptures.

item.title: Becoming Goodly Parents
item.description: There are many ways that goodly parents can access the help and support they need to teach the gospel of Jesus Christ to their children.

item.title: Obedience to Law Is Liberty
item.description: Men and women receive their agency as a gift from God, but their liberty and, in turn, their eternal happiness come from obedience to His laws.

item.title: The Doctrines and Principles Contained in the Articles of Faith
item.description: Each article of faith adds unique value to our understanding of the gospel of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Obedience through Our Faithfulness
item.description: L. Tom Perry teaches that obedience is a choice to trust in God's unlimited wisdom and power rather than our own limited knowledge and power.

item.title: Finding Lasting Peace and Building Eternal Families
Why Marriage and Family Matter—Everywhere in the World
item.description: Elder L. Tom Perry explains why marriage and family are still a universal ideal and why we must support efforts to strengthen them worldwide.
